src:
Pejners se budi
Letonski košarkaš polako počinje da pokazuje igre koje su se od njega očekivale od samog starta

03 Nov 2019

Mnogo se polemisalo na početku sezone o Partizanovim “stranim” pojačanjima. Trener Andrea Trinkijeri gotovo da je u potpunosti rekonstruisao ekipu, pa su se sa razlogom od svih očekivale dobre partije.
Od nekih smo ih već dobili - Rašon Tomas je od samog starta pokazao kakva je zver, a šlag na tortu stavio je na jučerašnjem meču protiv FMP-a, na kojem je postigao 23 poena uz indeks 31. Standardno dobar bio je Vil Mozli, koji Partizanu daje neophodnu čvrstinu pod samim obručem. Kori Volden sinoć nije igrao, ali je pokazao da može da bude od velike koristi Andrei Trinkijeriju, kada govorimo o organizaciji napada. Ali šta reći za Žanisa Pejnersa?



Letonski košarkaš nije baš blistao na početku sezone. Igra u odbrani nije bila na najboljem mogućem nivou, što je omogućilo rivalima da neretko dođu do zaista lakih koševa u igri jedan na jedan. Nije sve baš išlo najsjajnije ni u napadu, pa je Andrea Trinkijeri davao Pejnersu nešto manju minutažu.
Jasno je da je naporan raspored delom uticao na to da Letonac ne ispolji sav svoj potencijal odmah na startu takmičenja, mnogi su počeli i da sumnjaju da li je on pravo pojačanje za crno-belu ekipu, ali Pejners je tokom tekuće sedmice polako počeo da se budi i da “pokazuje puls”.
Može se reći da je protiv na meču protiv Limoža ove nedelje u Evrokupu, Žanis Pejners igrao glavnu ulogu u rukovođenju odbrane. Provevši na terenu gotovo 27 minuta, bio je to jasan pokazatelj da mu Andrea Trinkijeri veruje i da je napravio korak unapred u odnosu na neke prethodne utakmice. Solidan je bio i u ofanizvnom delu igre, gde je upisao osam poena.



Sinoć protiv FMP-a, Pejners je pružio možda i najbolju partiju od kako je došao u Partizan. U napadu je bio bez greške, pošto iz igre nije promašio, pritom upisavši devet poena, ali navijače i stručni štab crno-belih može da raduje činjenica da je Pejners konačno počeo da liči na pravi bedem u odbrambenoj liniji Parnog valjka.
Nakon nekoliko “minusa”, Letonac je polako počeo da skuplja i “pluseve” kod stručnog štaba Partizana. Svakom novom partijom, polako počinje da uliva nadu da bi i definitivno mogao da preuzme jednu od glavnih uloga na svojoj poziciji i tako reši crno-bele muka oko eventualne potrage za novin pojačanjima.
Sada samo ostaje da konačno “proradi” i Artjom Parahovski...



Piše: Srđan TODOROVIĆFoto: Star Sport, MN Press
text:
Payners wakes up
The Latvian basketball player is slowly starting to show the games that have been expected from the start

03 Nov 2019

There was much controversy at the beginning of the season about Partizan's "foreign" reinforcements. Coach Andrea Trinkieri almost completely rebuilt the team, so for good reason everyone expected good games.
We've already got some of them - Rashon Thomas showed from the start what a beast he was, and he put the icing on the cake in yesterday's match against FMP, which scored 23 points with an index of 31. Standard good was Will Mozley, who It gives Partisan the necessary firmness under the rim itself. Corey Volden did not play last night, but has shown that he can be of great help to Andrei Trinkieri when it comes to organizing the attack. But what to say about Jeanis Payners?



The Latvian basketball player did not shine at the start of the season. Defensive play was not at its best, allowing rivals to come up with really easy one-on-one points. Not everything went very well even in the attack, so Andrea Trinkieri gave Peyners a little less minute.
It is clear that the busy schedule partly influenced that the Latvian did not show his full potential at the start of the competition, many began to doubt whether he was the right reinforcement for the black and white team, but Peyners slowly started to improve during the current week. also be "showing a pulse".
It can be said that, in a match against Limoges this week at Eurocup, Jeanis Payners played a major role in leading the defense. Having spent almost 27 minutes on the pitch, it was a clear indication that Andrea Trinkieri trusted him and that he had taken a step ahead of some previous games. He was also solid in the offensive part of the game, where he scored eight points.



Last night against FMP, Peyners provided perhaps the best game since he came to Partizan. He was error-free in the attack, as he missed from the game, registering nine points, but the fans and the black and whites' professional staff can be pleased by the fact that Peinners finally began to resemble a real rampart in the Steam Roller defensive line.
After a few "minuses", the Latvian slowly began to collect "pluses" at Partizan's headquarters. With each new party, he slowly begins to hope that he could definitely take on one of the main roles in his position, thus resolving the black and white anguish over the eventual search for new reinforcements.
Now all that remains is to finally "work out" with Artjom Parahovski ...



By: Srdjan TODOROVICPhoto: Star Sport, MN Press
